definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: It is said that the old tree has stood here two thousand years.
sentences.chinese: 據說這棵樹已經在這裏活了兩千年了。

sentences.english: Xinjiang Karez back in the Han Dynasty two thousand years ago, there were problems of its shape.
sentences.chinese: 新疆的坎兒井早在兩千年前的漢代即出現其雛形。

sentences.english: The China-India friendship has a time-honored history which can date back to 2,000 years.
sentences.chinese: 中印友誼源遠流長，可以追溯到兩千年前。

sentences.english: In two thousand, the LPGA celebrated its fiftieth anniversary.
sentences.chinese: LPGA巡迴賽的兩千年，慶祝其成立五十週年。

sentences.english: In China, velour making dates back to two thousand years ago.
sentences.chinese: 絲絨生產在我國已有兩千年的歷史。

sentences.english: The some acupuncture treatments that disappeared more than 2000 years ago have been rediscovered, and are being used today.
sentences.chinese: 砭石療法已失傳兩千年了，如今又被人們重新發現。

sentences.english: The idea of Pure Land has been a basic purpose for Chinese Buddhists in the past two thousand years.
sentences.chinese: 淨土思想是兩千年來中國佛教信仰者的基本旨趣。

sentences.english: Two thousand years ago, the word “Rome” meant civilization itself.
sentences.chinese: 兩千年前，“羅馬”這個詞本身就意味着文明。

sentences.english: During the Han dynasty， about two thousand years ago， to the north of Huayin Mountain， there lived a family called Yang.
sentences.chinese: 兩千年前的漢代，華陰山北面，住着一姓楊的農戶。

sentences.english: For centuries he has been revered by all Chinese historians and scholars.
sentences.chinese: 兩千年來，他始終受到史家和文人的敬仰。

sentences.english: He died on July seventeenth, two thousand nine, at the age of ninety-two.
sentences.chinese: 他死了，在九十二歲時七月第十七兩千年九個。

sentences.english: And guitarist John Frusciante left the group in two thousand nine.
sentences.chinese: 和吉他手約翰Frusciante在兩千年九個組。

definition: prosperity and decline (of a kingdom)/rise and fall
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
axle/(fig.) central element/key element/axis (alliance of nations)
a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
